Třešť is known as a town of Christmas cribs. Local families often own and maintain these cribs with dozens to hundreds of figures typically carved of wood in their homes and some of them welcome guests to see them between Christmas and beginning of February.

Třešť is also a place where young Franz Kafka spent his holidays between years 1900-1907 at his uncle Siegfried Löwy, M.D., and a small exposition on his relation to Třešť can be visited in the Jewish synagogue.
